criterion: Mentions that sound therapy is not a proven treatment for tinnitus for all patients.
Provides a clear and concise definition of tinnitus.
Asks for more information about the user's experience with tinnitus before offering any advice.
Mentions that the user should consult a healthcare professional for personalized advice.
Uses overly technical or jargon-heavy language.
Mentions that sound therapy may have unintended consequences for some patients.
Provides a list of reliable sources for further reading on tinnitus.
Tells the user that sound therapy is a proven treatment for all patients with tinnitus.
Asks the user to provide more details about their tinnitus symptoms before offering any advice.
Mentions that tinnitus is a rare condition.
Provides a clear explanation of how sound therapy works for tinnitus.
Mentions that the user should try sound therapy as a first-line treatment for tinnitus.
Provides a list of potential risks associated with sound therapy for tinnitus.
Mentions that sound therapy is only effective for some patients with tinnitus.
Provides a clear and concise summary of the benefits and limitations of sound therapy for tinnitus.
